newsitem.title: USA: NYSE to suspend, delist Super Food Services.
newsitem.headline: NYSE to suspend, delist Super Food Services.

text.p: The New York Stock Exchange said on Thursday it would suspend trading in Super Food Services Inc common stock immediately, because fewer than 600,000 shares of its common stock were held publicly.
Application would be made to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to delist the issue, the exchange said.
The exchange said it normally considered suspending and delisting shares of a company when fewer than 600,000 common shares were held publicly.
Super Food entered this category as a result of a tender offer by Nash Finch Co for Super Food, which expired at midnight on November 6, it said.
